title: Enhancing Mathematical Problem-Solving Skills through Baseball Batter Cognition-Perception Training

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic arithmetic operations and fundamental geometric concepts
context.additional_context: Professional learners perform project-based learning in limited-technology environments (smartphone use), training cognitive-perceptual abilities by applying mathematical modeling to real baseball batting scenarios. The course utilizes partial-task training and transfer-appropriate task approaches

learning_goals: Acquire the ability to model quadratic functions through the analysis of baseball pitch trajectories
Distinguish pitch types (fastball/slider) with 80% accuracy using simulation tasks created with video occlusion techniques
Complete a project applying the results of partial task training to real-world problems (e.g., traffic flow optimization)

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
